document_data.name: Kara-Turan languages
document_data.mainbody: The '''Kara-Turan languages''' were a family of languages spoken by the majority of [[human]]s on the continent of [[Kara-Tur]].{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|27}}<ref group="note">Languages families for the languages of Kara-Tur have not yet been defined for the languages of Kara-Tur, as they were for the languages of [[Faer√ªn]] in the "Speaking in Tongues" article in [[Dragon Magazine Annual 1999|''Dragon Annual #4'']]. However, that article states that they do belong to a different languages family. This article collects all known languages of Kara-Tur for the purposes of organization and completeness, but they are not necessarily related.
document_data.Languages:
The following language groups belonged to the Kara-Turan language family:
* [[Amaese languages]]
* [[Han languages]]
* [[Shou Chiang languages]]

In addition, the following languages were also among this family:
* [[Bavanese language|Bavanese]]
* [[Bertanese language|Bertanese]]
* [[Kuong language|Kuong]]
* [[Laothan language|Laothan]]
* [[Lidahan]]
* [[Purang language|Purang]]
* [[Tabotan language|Tabotan]]
* [[Trade Tongue]]

The [[Chuchian]] language from the [[Imaskari languages]] family was also found among the languages of Kara-Tur.
